member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.RadioButtonEx
member.summary:
A radio button that solves the 2-way binding issue of the RadioButton.IsChecked property in WPF 3.5.
To solve the issue, use this implementation and bind to the instead of RadioButton.IsChecked.
For more information about the issue, see this forum thread: http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/forums/en-US/wpf/thread/8eb8280a-19c4-4502-8260-f74633a9e2f2/
member.remarks: This code is originally found at http://pstaev.blogspot.com/2008/10/binding-ischecked-property-of.html.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.RichToolTip
member.summary:
A kind-of Tooltip implementation that stays open once element is hovered and the content inside is responsive
It corresponds to most of the TooltipService attached properties so use them as you wish
Usage: (Like Tooltip)
<Control ToolTipService.Placement="Right"> <xmlns-pfx:RichToolTip.PopupContent> <TextBlock Text="This will be displayed in the popup" /> </xmlns-pfx:RichToolTip.PopupContent> </Control>
<Control ToolTipService.Placement="Right"> <xmlns-pfx:RichToolTip.PopupContent> <RichToolTip Placement="..." PlacementTarget="..." HorizontalOffset=".." and so on> <TextBlock Text="This will be displayed in the popup" /> </RichToolTip> </xmlns-pfx:RichToolTip.PopupContent> </Control>
Known Issues: 1 - I didn't have the time nor the strength to care about repositioning. I simply hide the popup whenever it would need repositioning. (Window movement, etc..) But it's ok since it's the default behavior of popup overall. 2 - XBap mode sets transparency through a hack! supported only in full trust. 3 - In XBap mode, moving the mouse slowly towards the popup will cause it to hide 4 - In XBap mode, moving the mouse over the element shows the tooltip even when the browser isn't the active window
member.remarks: Originally found at http://blogs.microsoft.co.il/blogs/zuker/archive/2009/01/18/wpf-popups-and-tooltip-behavior-solution.aspx

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.EmptyColumn
member.summary: Control to fill up a column in the control. This control is just a placeholder for a grid cell.

example.code:
<StackGrid> <StackGrid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="*" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </StackGrid.RowDefinitions>
<StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="*" /> </StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions>
<!-- Name, will be set to row 0, column 1 and 2 --> <Label Content="Name" /> <TextBox Text="{Bindng Name}" />
<!-- Empty row, will in this case use 2 columns --> <EmptyRow />
<!-- Wrappanel, will span 2 columns --> <WrapPanel StackGrid.ColumnSpan="2"> <Button Command="{Binding OK}" /> </WrapPanel> </StackGrid>

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Controls.EmptyColumn.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.EmptyRow
member.summary: Control to fill up a row in the control. This control will use an entire row to fill up.

example.code:
<StackGrid> <StackGrid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="*" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </StackGrid.RowDefinitions>
<StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="*" /> </StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions>
<!-- Name, will be set to row 0, column 1 and 2 --> <Label Content="Name" /> <TextBox Text="{Bindng Name}" />
<!-- Empty row, will in this case use 2 columns --> <EmptyRow />
<!-- Wrappanel, will span 2 columns --> <WrapPanel StackGrid.ColumnSpan="2"> <Button Command="{Binding OK}" /> </WrapPanel> </StackGrid>

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Controls.EmptyRow.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.StackGrid
member.summary:
A grid-like control that allows a developer to specify the rows and columns, but gives the freedom not to define the actual grid and row numbers of the controls inside the .
The automatically builds up the internal grid.

example.code:
<StackGrid> <StackGrid.RowDefinitions> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> <RowDefinition Height="*" /> <RowDefinition Height="Auto" /> </StackGrid.RowDefinitions>
<StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions> <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" /> <ColumnDefinition Width="*" /> </StackGrid.ColumnDefinitions>
<!-- Name, will be set to row 0, column 1 and 2 --> <Label Content="Name" /> <TextBox Text="{Bindng Name}" />
<!-- Empty row --> <EmptyRow />
<!-- Wrappanel, will span 2 columns --> <WrapPanel StackGrid.ColumnSpan="2"> <Button Command="{Binding OK}" /> </WrapPanel> </StackGrid>

member.name: F:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.PixelShaderMode
member.summary:
This property allows you to disable all pixel shaders in Catel.
By default, all pixel shaders are enabled.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.EnsureApplicationResourcesAndCreateStyleForwarders(System.Uri)
member.summary: Ensures that an application instance exists and the styles are applied to the application. This method is extremely useful to apply when WPF is hosted (for example, when loaded as plugin of a non-WPF application).

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.EnsureApplicationResourcesAndCreateStyleForwarders(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that an application instance exists and the styles are applied to the application. This method is extremely useful to apply when WPF is hosted (for example, when loaded as plugin of a non-WPF application).
member.param: The default prefix, uses to determine the styles as base for other styles.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CreateStyleForwardersForDefaultStyles
member.summary: Creates style forwarders for default styles. This means that all styles found in the theme that are name like Default[CONTROLNAME]Style (i.e. "DefaultButtonStyle") will be used as default style for the control. This method will use the current application ( to retrieve the resources. The forwarders will be written to the same dictionary.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CreateStyleForwardersForDefaultStyles(System.String)
member.summary: Creates style forwarders for default styles. This means that all styles found in the theme that are name like Default[CONTROLNAME]Style (i.e. "DefaultButtonStyle") will be used as default style for the control. This method will use the current application ( to retrieve the resources. The forwarders will be written to the same dictionary.
member.param: The default prefix, uses to determine the styles as base for other styles.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CreateStyleForwardersForDefaultStyles(System.Windows.ResourceDictionary)
member.summary: Creates style forwarders for default styles. This means that all styles found in the theme that are name like Default[CONTROLNAME]Style (i.e. "DefaultButtonStyle") will be used as default style for the control. This method will use the passed resources, but the forwarders will be written to the same dictionary as the source dictionary.
member.param: Resource dictionary to read the keys from (thus that contains the default styles).

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CreateStyleForwardersForDefaultStyles(System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Creates style forwarders for default styles. This means that all styles found in the theme that are name like Default[CONTROLNAME]Style (i.e. "DefaultButtonStyle") will be used as default style for the control. This method will use the passed resources, but the forwarders will be written to the same dictionary as the source dictionary.
member.param: Resource dictionary to read the keys from (thus that contains the default styles).
The default prefix, uses to determine the styles as base for other styles.

This method will use the passed resources.

This method will use the passed resources.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CreateStyleForwardersForDefaultStyles(System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates style forwarders for default styles. This means that all styles found in the theme that are name like Default[CONTROLNAME]Style (i.e. "DefaultButtonStyle") will be used as default style for the control. This method will use the passed resources.
member.param: Resource dictionary to read the keys from (thus that contains the default styles).
Resource dictionary where the forwarders will be written to.
if set to true, styles will not be completed but only forwarders are created.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.RecreateDefaultStylesBasedOnTheme(System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Recreates the default styles based on theme.
member.remarks: This method is introduced due to the lack of the ability to use DynamicResource for the BasedOn property when defining styles inside a derived theme.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.CloneStyleIfBasedOnControl(System.Windows.ResourceDictionary,System.Windows.Style,System.Type)
member.summary: Clones a style when the style is based on a control.
member.param: Type which the style is based on.
member.remarks:
This method is introduced due to the lack of the ability to use DynamicResource for the BasedOn property when defining styles inside a derived theme.
Should be used in combination with the RecreateDefaultStylesBasedOnTheme method.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.FindFrameworkElementStyleIsBasedOn(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Finds the a specific style is based on.
member.returns: or null if the style is not based on a .
member.remarks: This method is introduced due to the lack of the ability to use DynamicResource for the BasedOn property when defining styles inside a derived theme. Should be used in combination with the method.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.StyleHelper.IsStyleForwardingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether style forwarding is enabled. Style forwarding can be enabled by calling one of the overloads.
member.value: true if this instance is style forwarding enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the value of the attribute with the specified .
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, null is returned.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.GetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the value of the attribute with the specified and .
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. If the attribute is not found, null is returned. This method does not move the reader.
member.param: The namespace URI of the attribute.
The local name of the attribute.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.GetAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the value of the attribute with the specified index.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. This method does not move the reader.
member.param: The index of the attribute. The index is zero-based. (The first attribute has index 0.)

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the attribute with the specified .
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the attribute with the specified and .
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the first attribute.
member.returns: true if an attribute exists (the reader moves to the first attribute); otherwise, false (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the next attribute.
member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.ReadAttributeValue
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, parses the attribute value into one or more Text, EntityReference, or EndEntity nodes.
member.returns: true if there are nodes to return.false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read.An empty attribute, such as, misc="", returns true with a single node with a value of String.Empty.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Read
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.
member.exception: An error occurred while parsing the XML.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Close
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, changes the to Closed.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.LookupNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, resolves a namespace prefix in the current element's scope.
member.returns: The namespace URI to which the prefix maps or null if no matching prefix is found.
member.param: The prefix whose namespace URI you want to resolve. To match the default namespace, pass an empty string.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.ResolveEntity
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, resolves the entity reference for EntityReference nodes.
member.exception: The reader is not positioned on an EntityReference node; this implementation of the reader cannot resolve entities ( returns false).

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.System#Xml#IXmlNamespaceResolver#GetNamespacesInScope(System.Xml.XmlNamespaceScope)
member.summary: Gets a collection of defined prefix-namespace Mappings that are currently in scope.
member.returns: An that contains the current in-scope namespaces.
member.param: An value that specifies the type of namespace nodes to return.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.System#Xml#IXmlNamespaceResolver#LookupNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the namespace URI mapped to the specified prefix.
member.returns: The namespace URI that is mapped to the prefix; null if the prefix is not mapped to a namespace URI.
member.param: The prefix whose namespace URI you wish to find.

member.name: M:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.System#Xml#IXmlNamespaceResolver#LookupPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the prefix that is mapped to the specified namespace URI.
member.returns: The prefix that is mapped to the namespace URI; null if the namespace URI is not mapped to a prefix.
member.param: The namespace URI whose prefix you wish to find.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.NodeType
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the type of the current node.
member.returns: One of the values representing the type of the current node.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.LocalName
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the local name of the current node.
member.returns: The name of the current node with the prefix removed. For example, LocalName is book for the element <bk:book>.For node types that do not have a name (like Text, Comment, and so on), this property returns String.Empty.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.NamespaceURI
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the namespace URI (as defined in the W3C Namespace specification) of the node on which the reader is positioned.
member.returns: The namespace URI of the current node; otherwise an empty string.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Prefix
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.
member.returns: The namespace prefix associated with the current node.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.HasValue
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current node can have a .
member.returns: true if the node on which the reader is currently positioned can have a Value; otherwise, false. If false, the node has a value of String.Empty.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Resolver
member.summary: Returns object used to resolve types

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Value
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the text value of the current node.
member.returns: The value returned depends on the of the node. The following table lists node types that have a value to return. All other node types return String.Empty.Node type Value AttributeThe value of the attribute. CDATAThe content of the CDATA section. CommentThe content of the comment. DocumentTypeThe internal subset. ProcessingInstructionThe entire content, excluding the target. SignificantWhitespaceThe white space between markup in a mixed content model. TextThe content of the text node. WhitespaceThe white space between markup. XmlDeclarationThe content of the declaration.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.RootNamespaces
member.summary: Return root namespaces

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.Depth
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the depth of the current node in the XML document.
member.returns: The depth of the current node in the XML document.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.BaseURI
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the base URI of the current node.
member.returns: The base URI of the current node.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current node is an empty element (for example, <MyElement/>).
member.returns: true if the current node is an element ( equals XmlNodeType.Element) that ends with />; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.AttributeCount
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of attributes on the current node.
member.returns: The number of attributes on the current node.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.EOF
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the reader is positioned at the end of the stream.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned at the end of the stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.ReadState
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the state of the reader.
member.returns: One of the values.

member.name: P:Ricciolo.StylesExplorer.MarkupReflection.XmlBamlReader.NameTable
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the associated with this implementation.
member.returns: The XmlNameTable enabling you to get the atomized version of a string within the node.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Media.Effects.EmptyEffect
member.summary: Empty effect that simply copies the pixel color (so it doesn't make ANY changes to pixels).
member.remarks:
Implemented to be able to disable pixel shaders in Catel.
During the build of Catel, this pixel shader effect will not be recompiled to prevent all users to install the DirectX SDK. If you want to make changes, take a look at the readme of Catel.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Choice
member.summary: Class representing a choice that can be used in the .

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Choice.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new choice where the text displayed is the same as the value of the choice comment when this choice is chosen.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Choice.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new reason where the text displayed is different then the value of the reason when this reason is chosen.
member.param: Text to set to reason when this reason is chosen.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Choice.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a new reason where the text displayed is different then the value of the reason when this reason is chosen.
This constructor also allows to specify whether customization is allowed.
member.param: Text to set to reason when this reason is chosen.
If true, customization is allowed for this reason.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Choice.AllowCustomization
member.summary: Gets whether this reason allows customization.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Choice.Header
member.summary: Gets the reason header. This text will be used to display the reason in the list of available reasons.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Choice.Explanation
member.summary: Gets the explanation of the reason. This text will be used to fill the reason text when this reason is chosen.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tag.
